Package model

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    IMove
    The generic Move interface All moves have to be able to have tiles added, and push themselves to a level They also have to know whether or not they are valid
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AbstractTileContainer
    The abstract representation of a TileContainer in the Board.
    Achievement
    System for achievements.
    BeatALevelAchievement
    An achievement for beating your first level!
    Board
    The model that represents the board.
    BucketTileContainer
    Buckets are only used in th "Release" level type.
    ClearMove
    A ClearMove operates on a single NumberTileContainer Clearing the tile removes the number, and then the board should settle.
    EliminationLevel
    The goal of an elimination level is to use every tile once in a UserMove (Special moves do not count) You have a certain number of moves to try to accomplish this, and if you do not mark all tiles before you run out of moves, you lose
    IOnLevelAchievement
    Acheivements that are calculated after the completion of a level.
    Level
    A class to hold anything that all Levels have in common This includes: The Game board values Score milestones (1/2/3 stars) Number of special moves As well as some common behavior associated with these attributes
    LevelState  
    LightningLevel  
    LightningTimer  
    LightningTimerTask  
    LoadedAchievement
    An achievement for loading the game.
    NullTileContainer  
    NumberTileContainer  
    OnMoveAchievement
    Acheivements that are calculated after each move is made.
    OverachieverMoveAchievement
    A secret achievement for obtaining the highest score possible in the game
    Player  
    PuzzleLevel  
    RearrangeMove
    Rearrange moves clear all non-null, non-empty, non-six tiles on the board and replace them with new randomly generated tiles Sixes are never replaced because it can make Release levels unwinnable
    ReleaseLevel
    Release levels have a number of buckets.
    SixTilesMoveAchievement
    An achievement for making a move that contains 6 tiles
    SwapMove
    A swap move swaps two adjacent tiles on the board Only non-empty, non-null tiles can be swapped Once two tiles are added, the move is valid and should be run
    TestAchievements  
    TestBucketTileContainer  
    TestClearMove  
    TestEliminationLevel  
    TestLevelState  
    TestNumberTileContainer  
    TestPuzzleLevel  
    TestRearrangeMove  
    TestSwapMove  
    TestTile  
    TestUserMove  
    ThreeStarsLevelAchievement
    An Achievement for beating a level with three stars!
    Tile
    A tile is the actual data contained by a Square on the board Each tile should always be inside a TileContainer Tiles have a number and a multiplier
    TwoBadMovesAchievement  
    UserMove
    UserMove is the basic move type for the SixesWild game They are the only way to score points or mark tiles in Elimination rounds A valid UserMove is 2 or more adjacent tiles that sum to 6
